title: Sidney986
author: Sidney986
content: I installed Electrum v4.4.5.0 on Android.  Went into network and enabled proxy settings so I could use Tor network.  I left settings as default which areSOCKS5/TOR127.0.0.19050The round light remains red.Username and password are no set.  Do I have to register somewhere?

comments.author: BitcoinGirl.Club
comments.created_time: July 15, 2023, 09:03:18 PMLast edit: July 15, 2023, 11:36:19 PM by BitcoinGirl.Club
comments.body: Download orbot.Install itOpen itAdd Electrum on the app list.Turn on the OrbitNow, open Electrum. It should bridged with Electrum.The connection it will use, will be the connection from Orbot (TOR)Update: You need to set the following Enable ProxySOCKSS/TORAddress: 127.0.0.1 Port 9050Press OkThe network indicator will turn Blue which means TOR is enabled.

comments.author: Charles-Tim
comments.body: At the top right corner, it would appear in green if Tor is not enabled (left image). If Tor is enabled, it would be in blue (right image).     It would be in red if not connected at all. Because you set it to use Tor, if you connect with just IP connection, it will not connect and red will appear.

comments.author: Sidney986
comments.body: Quote from: BitcoinGirl.Club on July 15, 2023, 09:03:18 PMDownload orbit.Install itOpen itAdd Electrum on the app list.Turn on the OrbitNow, open Electrum. It should bridged with Electrum.The connection it will use, will be the connection from Orbit (TOR)Update: You need to set the following Enable ProxySOCKSS/TORAddress: 127.0.0.1 Port 9050Press OkThe network indicator will turn Blue which means TOR is enabled.Thank you.  Worked great.  Blue circle now.    It's Orbot not Orbit.

comments.author: BitcoinGirl.Club
comments.body: Quote from: Sidney986 on July 15, 2023, 09:24:31 PMQuote from: BitcoinGirl.Club on July 15, 2023, 09:03:18 PMDownload orbot.Install itOpen itAdd Electrum on the app list.Turn on the OrbotNow, open Electrum. It should bridged with Electrum.The connection it will use, will be the connection from Orbot (TOR)Update: You need to set the following Enable ProxySOCKSS/TORAddress: 127.0.0.1 Port 9050Press OkThe network indicator will turn Blue which means TOR is enabled.Thank you.  Worked great.  Blue circle now.    It's Orbot not Orbit.It's Orbot LOL, fixed it.When you are enabling proxry with SOCKSS/TOR, you are telling the system to receive connection from TOR but if your TOR is not active in the background then it fails to receive connection. Earlier you did not have TOR active in the background that's why after doing everything else correctly, it was still showing Red indicator because it was not receiving connection from TOR.When the indicator is Green while your TOR is active and TOR have Electrum in it's app list, I think it still use the connection from TOR. But since the Proxy is not enabled, the Electrum thinks it's your regular connection.On mobile device, TOR means you need Orbot.All these are my understanding of how the system works.

comments.author: Sidney986
comments.body: Curious to know why proxy settings have user name and password option when tor works with those fields empty.

comments.author: BitcoinGirl.Club
comments.body: Quote from: Sidney986 on July 16, 2023, 03:52:18 PMCurious to know why proxy settings have user name and password option when tor works with those fields empty.No idea why they are for but as long as we have others things are working perfectly, I think let's ignore the rest. May be there will be some information about it on Electrum domination. I am not much interested to spend time there.

comments.author: BitMaxz
comments.body: Quote from: Sidney986 on July 16, 2023, 03:52:18 PMCurious to know why proxy settings have user name and password option when tor works with those fields empty.That username and password are for the Socks5 proxy because they support authentication. If you have bought a dedicated Socks5 proxy you can enable authentication with a username and password it generated a user and password that can be used on Electrum.You can just leave it empty since you already made it work through TOR.

comments.author: notocactus
comments.body: Quote from: BitcoinGirl.Club on July 15, 2023, 09:03:18 PMDownload orbot.Sidney86Some links for OrbotWhat is Orbot?Proxy with TorQuoteOrbot is a free app from The Guardian Project that empowers other apps on your device to use the internet more securely. Orbot uses Tor to encrypt your Internet traffic and hide it by bouncing through a series of computers around the world.Downloadhttps://orbot.app/en/
